page.title: 05BIRDLIFE IN SOUTH DEVON
page.content: Birdlife in this part of the South Hams,Devon,is quite varied.Most noticeable are the rooks,whos noisy behaviour in the high trees is impossible to ignore.Their cousins the magpies are also quite common, usually seen in pairs.A pair of jays live in the woods near Membland.Also widespread are pigeons,who nest in woods or little-used buildings and are regarded by the farmers as pests because of their enormous appetites.A colourful addition to the countryside are pheasnts (or,at least,the cock bird).Once bred to be shot,pheasant shoots are no longer held here so the birds are now wild.They are quite stupid,and often get knocked down on the roads...then quickly taken home for dinner! Smaller birds here are sparrows, starlings and robins who tend to live
